title: Boy's Kimono
text: The training of predatory birds for hunting and sport has a long tradition in Japan. In the Edo period (1600-1868), master falconers (<I>takajo_<I>) were accorded special rank withinthe samurai hierarchy. This boy's costume is decorated with falcons as a fitting emblem of male strength and focused determination.
description: silk padded kimono; brown and white alternating bands, feathered appearance between bands; printed falcon designs with black pole and purple tie repeated throughout
creditline: Gift of funds from the Asian Art Council
